title: Shiro Plum  My First Fruit & How You Can Grow One Too #shorts

tasks.task: Planting and nurturing a Shiro plum tree
subtasks: Identify the Shiro plum tree variety
Ensure the tree is in USDA zones 5-9
Provide full sun for the tree
Monitor tree growth (15-20 feet tall naturally)
Prune tree to control height (6-8 feet)
Shape tree during late winter pruning
Pollinate tree for better yield (consider Burbank or Santa Rosa)
Wait for 3-5 years for fruit production
Enjoy fresh eating, jams, and desserts
